//! Game Engine functionality.
7
8

9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11

12
13

14
15

16
    event_loop::EventLoop,
17
    events::EventHandler,
18
    screen::Screen,
19

20
};
21
pub use wyn::{
22
    screen::ScreenInfo,
23
    types::{Coord, Extent, Point, Rect, Size},
24
};
25
26
use std::{
27
    ops::{Deref, DerefMut},
28
    sync::{Condvar, Mutex},
29
};
30
31
use parking_lot::{RwLock, RwLockWriteGuard};
32

// ================================================================================================================================ //
34
35
/// A trait that represents an App/Game.
36
pub trait Game: Sync {
37
    /// The core game logic should be run.
38
    /// Return `false` or `panic` to stop the Game Loop.
39
    fn update(&mut self, engine: &mut EngineState) -> bool;
40
41
    /// The render logic should be run.
42
    /// Return `false` or `panic` to stop the Game Loop.
43
    fn render(&mut self, engine: &mut EngineState) -> bool;
44
}
45
46
// ================================================================================================================================ //
47
48
/// Runner for Game Loops.
49
pub struct GameEngine<'a> {
50
    /// Internal shared state, wrapped in a Reader-Writer Lock.
51
    state: RwLock<(&'a mut dyn Game, EngineState)>,
52
53
    /// Condition Variable for awaiting/signaling VSYNC.
54
    vsync_condvar: Condvar,
55
56
    /// Mutex holding the Number of the Last Update that was rendered.
57
    vsync_mutex: Mutex<usize>,
58
59
    /// The queued input-events.
60
    inputs: Mutex<Inputs>,
61
62
    /// Initial settings.
63
    init_settings: GameEngineSettings,
64
}
65
unsafe impl<'a> Sync for GameEngine<'a> {}
66
67
/// State wrapped by Game Engine.
68
pub struct EngineState {
69
    /// Vulkan Renderer.
70
    pub(crate) vk: Vulkan,
71
72
    /// The visible Window on the Desktop.
73
    pub(crate) wyn_window: Option<Window>,
74
75
    /// User-control for Window.\
76
    /// The user may change these during the Render callback.
77
    pub window: WindowSettings,
78
79
    /// Settings for the Renderer.\
80
    /// The user may change these during the Render callback.
81
    pub render: RenderSettings,
82
83
    /// Information about the connected Screens/Monitors.
84
    pub screens: Vec<ScreenInfo>,
85
86
    /// The Inputs that were queued between Update calls.
87
    pub inputs: Inputs,
88
89
    /// Timer for scheduling Update-calls.
90
    pub timer: FrameTimer,
91
}
92
93

    /// Writes the Rendered-Update Count and notifies the Update Thread.

/// Updates the Window-Settings of a Window.
434
7.84k
fn write_window(events: &EventLoop, window: &Window, settings: &WindowSettings) {
435
7.84k
    let old_name = window.name(events).unwrap();
436
7.84k
    let new_name = &settings.name;
437
7.84k
    if new_name != &old_name {
438
6.18k
        window.rename(events, new_name).unwrap();
439
6.18k
    }
440
441
7.84k
    let old_rect = window.content_rect(events).unwrap();
442
7.84k
    let new_rect = settings.rect;
443
7.84k
    if new_rect != old_rect {
444
6
        window.reposition_content(events, new_rect).unwrap();
445
7.83k
    }
446
447
7.84k
    let old_fullscreen = window.is_fullscreen(events);
448
7.84k
    let new_fullscreen = settings.fullscreen;
449
7.84k
    if new_fullscreen != old_fullscreen {
450
54
        if new_fullscreen {
451
27
            window.set_style(events, WindowStyle::Borderless).unwrap();
452
27
            window.fullscreen(events).unwrap();
453
27
        } else {
454
27
            window.restore(events).unwrap();
455
27
            window.set_style(events, WindowStyle::Captioned).unwrap();
456
27
        }
457
7.78k
    }

pub enum Input {
21
    /// The Window's focus has changed.
22
    WindowFocus {
23
        /// Focused or Unfocused flag.
24
        focused: bool,
25
    },
26
    /// A Mouse-Cursor was moved in the Window.
27
    CursorMove {
28
        /// The position of the cursor, in pixel-coordinates.
29
        point: Point,
30
    },
31
    /// A Scroll-Wheel was scrolled in the Window.
32
    ScrollWheel {
33
        /// The horizontal scroll units.
34
        delta_x: f64,
35
        /// The vertical scroll units.
36
        delta_y: f64,
37
    },
38
    /// A Mouse-Button was pressed/released in the Window.
39
    ButtonPress {
40
        /// The button-code.
41
        button: MouseButton,
42
        /// Pressed or Released flag.
43
        pressed: bool,
44
    },
45
    /// A Keyboard-Key was pressed/released in the Window.
46

47
        /// The key-code.
48
        keycode: KeyCode,
49
        /// Pressed or Release flag.
50
        pressed: bool,
51
    },
52
    /// A Character was input in the Window.
53
    CharacterInput {
54
        /// The character-code.
55
        character: char,
56
    },
57
}

//! # Rust Game Engine (RGE)
8
//!
9
//! A library that makes writing a game simple.
10
//!
11
//! Supports 2D Graphics, such as Sprites, Tilemaps, and Shapes.
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //

15

pub struct Texture {

impl Texture {

    // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //

    // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //

//! Timer that allows syncing to a particular Framerate by sleeping.

/// A waitable timer that syncs to a desired Frames-Per-Second.
18
pub struct FrameTimer {
19
    /// Whether or not the Timer should VSYNC.
20

21

    /// The desired Frames-Per-Second to target.
23

24
25
    /// The Instant the Timer was started.
26
    epoch: Instant,
27
28
    /// The last recorded Instant.
29
    tick: Instant,
30
}

/// Initializes any OS-related state for proper Timer functionality.
222
6
fn init_os_timer() {
223
6
    #[cfg(target_os = "windows")]
224
6
    {
225
6
        let mut caps = unsafe { core::mem::zeroed() };
226
6
        let caps_size = size_of::<sys::TIMECAPS>() as u32;
227
6
228
6
        let res = unsafe { sys::timeGetDevCaps(addr_of_mut!(caps), caps_size) };
229
6
        assert_eq!(res, sys::MMSYSERR_NOERROR);
230
231
6
        let res = unsafe { sys::timeBeginPeriod(caps.wPeriodMin) };
232
6
        assert_eq!(res, sys::TIMERR_NOERROR);
233
    }
234
6
}

/// Wrapper for a `VkDebugUtilsMessengerEXT`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkDebugUtilsMessengerEXT.html>
17

19

20

23
}

60
        message_severity: vk::DebugUtilsMessageSeverityFlagsEXT,
93
60
        message_type: vk::DebugUtilsMessageTypeFlagsEXT,
94
60
        callback_data: *const vk::DebugUtilsMessengerCallbackDataEXT,
95
60

96
60

97
60
        // Do not let any PANICs escape.
98
60
        let _ = std::panic::catch_unwind(move || {
99
            let msg_severity = match message_severity {
100
                vk::DebugUtilsMessageSeverityFlagsEXT::ERROR => "ERROR",
101
                vk::DebugUtilsMessageSeverityFlagsEXT::WARNING => "WARNING",
102
                vk::DebugUtilsMessageSeverityFlagsEXT::INFO => "INFO",
103

104

105
            };
106

107
                vk::DebugUtilsMessageTypeFlagsEXT::GENERAL => "GENERAL",
108
                vk::DebugUtilsMessageTypeFlagsEXT::PERFORMANCE => "PERFORMANCE",
109
                vk::DebugUtilsMessageTypeFlagsEXT::VALIDATION => "VALIDATION",
110
                _ => unreachable!(),
111
            };
112
113
            let (id, msg) = if let Some(data) = unsafe { callback_data.as_ref() } {
114

115
                let msg = unsafe { CStr::from_ptr(data.p_message) }.to_string_lossy();
116

117

118

119
                let msg = Cow::Borrowed("");
120

121
            };

124

        });

/// Wrapper for a `VkInstance`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkInstance.html>
17
pub struct Instance {
18
    /// Inner `ash` `VkInstance`.
19
    pub inner: ash::Instance,
20
21
    /// Layers supported by this Instance.
22
    pub layers: Layers,
23
24
    /// Extensions supported by this Instance.
25
    pub extensions: Extensions,
26
}
27
28
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
29
30
impl Instance {
31
    /// Queries the Supported Extensions/Layers and creates a Vulkan Instance.
32
6
    pub fn new(entry: &ash::Entry) -> Aliased<Self> {
33
6
        let extensions = Extensions::supported_instance(entry);
34
6
        let required_extensions = Extensions::required_instance();
35
6
        let unsupported_extensions: Vec<_> =
36
6
            extensions.unsupported(required_extensions.iter()).collect();
37
6
        assert!(unsupported_extensions.is_empty());
38
39
6
        let layers = Layers::supported_instance(entry);
40
6
        let required_layers = Layers::required_instance();
41
6
        let unsupported_layers: Vec<_> = layers.unsupported(required_layers.iter()).collect();
42
6
        assert!(unsupported_layers.is_empty());
43
44
6
        let app_info = vk::ApplicationInfo {
45
6
            api_version: vk::make_api_version(0, 1, 0, 0),
46
6
            ..Default::default()
47
6
        };
48
6
49
6
        let create_info = vk::InstanceCreateInfo {
50
6
            p_application_info: &app_info,
51
6
            pp_enabled_extension_names: required_extensions.as_ptr() as *const *const c_char,
52
6
            enabled_extension_count: required_extensions.len() as u32,
53
6
            pp_enabled_layer_names: required_layers.as_ptr() as *const *const c_char,
54
6
            enabled_layer_count: required_layers.len() as u32,
55
6
            ..Default::default()
56
6
        };
57
6
        let inner = unsafe { entry.create_instance(&create_info, None) }.unwrap();
58
6
59
6
        let this = Self {
60
6
            inner,
61
6
            extensions,
62
6
            layers,
63
6
        };
64
6

6

/// OS-specific Surface Extension.
17

/// OS-specific Surface Extension.
21

24
/// OS-specific Surface Extension.
25

/// Collection of loaded Instance Extension functions.
30
pub struct InstanceExts {

    ///   Linux: <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_KHR_xcb_surface.html>\

    ///   MacOS: <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_metal_surface.html>
37
    pub native_surface: NativeSurfaceExt,
38
39
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_debug_utils.html>
40
    pub debug_utils: ext::DebugUtils,
41
}

35

5
6
//! Utilities for interoperating with Vulkan.
7
//!
8
//! Dependencies:
9
//! * <https://docs.rs/ash/latest/ash/>
10
//!
11
//! Documentation:
12
//! * <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/html/index.html>
13
14
// ================================================================================================================================ //
15
16
#[allow(unused_imports)]
17
use super::*;
18
19
// ================================================================================================================================ //
20
21

/// All necessary Vulkan State required for GPU-Accelerated Rendering.
39
pub struct Vulkan {
40
    /// The Vulkan Renderable, associated with a Window.
41
    renderable: Option<Aliased<VulkanRenderable>>,
42
43
    /// The Vulkan Context.
44
    context: Aliased<VulkanContext>,
45
}

17
    ///
18
    /// If either of the Window dimensions (width or height) is 0, this function will return without rendering.\
19
    /// In some cases (such as the Window being resized), rendering may spuriously fail.\
20

    /// Queries the Size of the Render Surface's Window and updates internal state as needed, returning boolean flags to indicate the changes.\
92
    /// The 0th flag represents whether the Window size is valid (non-zero in both dimensions).
93

7.83k

    /// Attempts to render a Frame.\
131
    /// Returns `true` if succeeded, and `false` if the swapchain needs updated.
132
7.79k
    fn render_frame(&self, settings: &RenderSettings) -> bool {
133
7.79k
        let prev_frame = self.frames.list.get(self.prev_frame_idx()).unwrap();
134
7.79k

135
7.79k
136
7.79k

137
7.79k
        let render_finished = this_frame.sync.render.handle;
138
7.79k

7.79k

143
        // <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/vkQueuePresentKHR.html>
144
145

146
147
7.79k
        let Some(image_idx) = self.acquire_image(image_acquired, &[this_frame_available, prev_frame_available], &[this_frame_available])
148

149
0
            return false;
150
        };

7.79k

7.79k

7.79k

    /// Attempts to acquires a Frame from the Swapchain.
174
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/vkAcquireNextImageKHR.html>
175
7.79k
    fn acquire_image(
176
7.79k
        &self,
177
7.79k
        signal_semaphore: vk::Semaphore,
178
7.79k
        wait_fences: &[vk::Fence],
179
7.79k
        reset_fences: &[vk::Fence],
180
7.79k
    ) -> Option<u32> {
181
7.79k
        let device = unsafe { self.device() };
182
7.79k
        let ash_device = device.ash_device();
183
7.79k
        let frames = &self.frames;
184
7.79k
        let swapchain = &frames.swapchain;
185
7.79k
        let swapchain_ext = unsafe { swapchain.ext() };
186
7.79k
187
7.79k
        // -------------------------------- //
188
7.79k
189
7.79k
        let res = unsafe { ash_device.wait_for_fences(wait_fences, true, u64::MAX) };
190
7.79k
        res.unwrap();

    fn acquire_image(

    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
745
746
    /// Transitions the Atlas Image from one Layout to another.
747
1.81k
    pub fn transition_atlas(
748
1.81k
        &self,
749
1.81k
        atlas: &Atlas,
750
1.81k
        _format: vk::Format,
751
1.81k
        old_layout: vk::ImageLayout,
752
1.81k
        new_layout: vk::ImageLayout,
753
1.81k
    ) {
754
1.81k
        let (src_access, dst_access, src_stage, dst_stage) = match (old_layout, new_layout) {
755
            (vk::ImageLayout::UNDEFINED, vk::ImageLayout::TRANSFER_DST_OPTIMAL) => {
756
907
                let src_access = vk::AccessFlags::empty();
757
907
                let dst_access = vk::AccessFlags::TRANSFER_WRITE;
758
907
                let src_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::TOP_OF_PIPE;
759
907
                let dst_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::TRANSFER;
760
907
                (src_access, dst_access, src_stage, dst_stage)
761
            }
762
            (vk::ImageLayout::TRANSFER_DST_OPTIMAL, vk::ImageLayout::SHADER_READ_ONLY_OPTIMAL) => {
763
907
                let src_access = vk::AccessFlags::TRANSFER_WRITE;
764
907
                let dst_access = vk::AccessFlags::SHADER_READ;
765
907
                let src_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::TRANSFER;
766
907
                let dst_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::FRAGMENT_SHADER;
767
907

    pub fn transition_atlas(
748
1.81k
        &self,

1.81k

750
1.81k

751
1.81k

752
1.81k

753
1.81k

754
1.81k
        let (src_access, dst_access, src_stage, dst_stage) = match (old_layout, new_layout) {
755
            (vk::ImageLayout::UNDEFINED, vk::ImageLayout::TRANSFER_DST_OPTIMAL) => {
756
907
                let src_access = vk::AccessFlags::empty();
757
907
                let dst_access = vk::AccessFlags::TRANSFER_WRITE;
758
907
                let src_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::TOP_OF_PIPE;
759
907
                let dst_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::TRANSFER;
760
907
                (src_access, dst_access, src_stage, dst_stage)
761

762

763
907
                let src_access = vk::AccessFlags::TRANSFER_WRITE;
764
907
                let dst_access = vk::AccessFlags::SHADER_READ;
765
907
                let src_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::TRANSFER;
766
907
                let dst_stage = vk::PipelineStageFlags::FRAGMENT_SHADER;
767
907

    /// Copies the Texture data to the Staging Buffer.
806
907
    fn stage_texture(&self, atlas: &Atlas, texture: &Texture) {
807
907
        let tex_size = texture.vk_device_size();
808
907
        assert!(tex_size == atlas.image.size);
809
907
        assert!(tex_size <= self.buffers.staging.size);
810
811
907
        {
812
907
            let mut mem = unsafe { self.buffers.memory.map(self.buffers.staging.offs, tex_size) };
813
907
            let pixels = texture.as_slice();
814
907
            let bytes = utils::bytes_ref(pixels);
815
907
            mem.copy_to(0, bytes);
816
907
        }
817
907
    }

// ================================================================================================================================ //
39
40
/// A collection of parameters to select a Physical Device for Logical Device creation.
41
pub struct DeviceSelection {
42
    /// Index of the Present-Queue Family.
43
    pub present_idx: usize,
44
45
    /// Index of the Graphics-Queue Family.
46
    pub graphics_idx: usize,
47
48
    /// Index of the Physical Device.
49
    pub physical_idx: usize,
50
51
    /// Pointer to the object that holds the resources referenced by the selected indices.
52
    context_ptr: NonNull<VulkanContext>,
53
}
54
55

    /// Given a list of a Physical Devices, picks the best one to use to render to the given Window Surface.
82
6
    pub fn new(context: &VulkanContext, surface: &Surface) -> Self {
83
6
        let context_ptr = NonNull::from(context);
84
6
85
6
        let physical_ranks = Self::device_rankings(&context.devices, surface);
86
6
        let physical_best = physical_ranks.max().unwrap();
87
6

88
6
        let physical_ref = context.devices.get(physical_idx).unwrap();
89
6
90
6

91
6
        let graphics_best = graphics_ranks.max().unwrap();
92
6

93
6
        assert!(physical_ref.queues.get(graphics_idx).is_some());
94
95
6

96
6

    /// Ranks a Physical Device.\

    /// It must support all the required Extensions and Layers.\
156

/// Information about a Device/Surface combination.
16
pub struct DeviceSurfaceInfo {
17
    /// Whether or not each Queue-Family supports the Surface.
18
    pub support: Vec<bool>,
19
20
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPresentModeKHR.html>
21
    pub modes: Vec<vk::PresentModeKHR>,
22
23
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSurfaceFormatKHR.html>
24
    pub formats: Vec<vk::SurfaceFormatKHR>,
25
26
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.html>
27
    pub capabilities: vk::SurfaceCapabilitiesKHR,
28
}

/*

5
6
//! Internal utilities for managing Vulkan Framebuffers.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// Handles to objects associated with a Frame that can be rendered to and presented to the screen.
16
pub struct Frame {
17
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkCommandBuffer.html>
18
    pub commands: vk::CommandBuffer,
19
20
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkFramebuffer.html>
21
    pub buffer: vk::Framebuffer,
22
23
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkImageView.html>
24
    pub view: vk::ImageView,
25
26
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkImage.html>
27
    pub image: vk::Image,
28
29
    /// Synchronization Primitives for accessing this Frame.
30
    pub sync: Sync,
31
32
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
33
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
34
}
35
36
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
37
38

    pub unsafe fn device(&self) -> &Device {

44
246
    }

/// A collection of Multiple Frames owned by a Swapchain.
149
pub struct Frames {
150
    /// The list of Frames.
151
    pub list: Vec<Frame>,
152
153
    /// The Swapchain that owns the Frames.
154
    pub swapchain: Swapchain,
155
156
    /// The `VkCommandBuffers` allocated from the `VkCommandPool`.
157
    pub commands: Vec<vk::CommandBuffer>,
158
}
159
160
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
161
162
impl Frames {
163
    /// Creates a Swapchain for the given Device/Surface and collects the Frames associated with it.
164
6
    pub fn collect(
165
6
        device: &Device,
166
6
        surface: &Surface,
167
6
        ds_info: &DeviceSurfaceInfo,
168
6
        render_pass: &RenderPass,
169
6
        pool: &CommandPool,
170
6
        vsync: bool,
171
6
    ) -> Self {
172
6
        let swapchain = Swapchain::new(device, surface, ds_info, vsync, None);
173
6
174
6
        let images = swapchain.collect_images();
175
6
        let commands = pool.allocate_buffers(images.len());
176
6
        assert_eq!(images.len(), commands.len());
177
6
        let zipped = (images.into_iter()).zip(commands.iter().cloned());
178
6
179
6
        let list = zipped
180
18
            .map(|(image, commands)| {
181
18
                Frame::new(device, surface, ds_info, render_pass, image, commands)
182
18
            })

//! Internal utilities for managing Vulkan Logical Devices and Queues.

/// Wrapper for a `VkDevice`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkDevice.html>
17
pub struct LogicalDevice {
18
    /// Queue for Presenting Images to a Surface.
19
    pub present_queue: vk::Queue,
20
21
    /// Queue for Submitting Graphics commands.
22
    pub graphics_queue: vk::Queue,
23
24
    /// Inner `ash` `VkDevice`.
25
    pub inner: ash::Device,
26
}
27
28
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
29
30
impl LogicalDevice {
31
    /// Creates a Logical Device from the given 
32
6
    pub fn new(instance: &ash::Instance, selection: &DeviceSelection) -> Self {
33
6
        let graphics_queue_create_info = vk::DeviceQueueCreateInfo {
34
6
            queue_family_index: selection.graphics_idx as u32,
35
6
            queue_count: 1,
36
6
            p_queue_priorities: &1.0_f32,
37
6
            ..Default::default()
38
6
        };
39
6
        let present_queue_create_info = vk::DeviceQueueCreateInfo {
40
6
            queue_family_index: selection.present_idx as u32,
41
6
            queue_count: 1,
42
6
            p_queue_priorities: &1.0_f32,
43
6
            ..Default::default()
44
6
        };
45
6
46
6
        let queue_create_infos = [graphics_queue_create_info, present_queue_create_info];
47
6
48
6
        let device_features = vk::PhysicalDeviceFeatures {
49
6
            ..Default::default()
50
6
        };
51
6
52
6
        let required_extensions = Extensions::required_device();
53
6
        let required_layers = Layers::required_device();
54
6
55
6
        let device_create_info = vk::DeviceCreateInfo {
56
6
            p_enabled_features: &device_features,
57
6
            p_queue_create_infos: queue_create_infos.as_ptr(),
58
6
            queue_create_info_count: selection.unique_queue_count(),
59
6
            pp_enabled_extension_names: required_extensions.as_ptr() as *const *const c_char,
60
6
            enabled_extension_count: required_extensions.len() as u32,
61
6
            pp_enabled_layer_names: required_layers.as_ptr() as *const *const c_char,
62
6
            enabled_layer_count: required_layers.len() as u32,
63
6
            ..Default::default()
64
6
        };
65
6
66
6
        let res = unsafe {
67
6
            instance.create_device(selection.physical().handle, &device_create_info, None)
68
6
        };
69
6
        let inner = res.unwrap();
70
6
71
6
        let graphics_queue = unsafe { inner.get_device_queue(selection.graphics_idx as u32, 0) };
72
6
        let present_queue = unsafe { inner.get_device_queue(selection.present_idx as u32, 0) };
73
6
74
6
        Self {
75
6
            present_queue,
76
6
            graphics_queue,
77
6
            inner,
78
6
        }
79
6
    }

//! Internal utilities for managing Renderable-State associated with a Window in Vulkan.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //

#[allow(unused_imports)]

use super::*;

// ================================================================================================================================ //

/// A combination of a Vulkan Device/Surface with its associated Shaders & Graphics Pipelines.
43
pub struct VulkanRenderable {
44
    /// Index of the current Frame.
45
    pub frame_idx: usize,
46
47
    /// List of Frames to be rendered.
48
    pub frames: Frames,
49
50
    /// Compiled Shader Programs.
51
    pub shaders: Shaders,
52
53
    /// Texture atlases.
54
    pub atlas: Option<Atlas>,
55
56
    /// The Command Pool for allocating Command Buffers.
57
    pub command_pool: CommandPool,
58
59
    /// Memory Buffers for CPU-GPU interaction.
60
    pub buffers: Buffers,
61
62
    /// Information about the Device/Surface combination.
63
    pub ds_info: DeviceSurfaceInfo,
64
65
    /// The Logical Device for using Vulkan.
66
    pub device: Aliased<Device>,
67
68
    /// The Window Surface.
69
    pub surface: Surface,
70
71
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
72
    context_ptr: NonNull<VulkanContext>,
73
}
74
75
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
76
77
/// Getter functions for variables behind `Aliased` pointers.
78
#[allow(clippy::missing_docs_in_private_items)]
79
#[allow(unused)]

/// Wrapper for a `VkSurfaceKHR`.
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSurfaceKHR.html>
17
pub struct Surface {
18
    /// Cached size of Window Framebuffer.
19
    pub size: vk::Extent2D,
20
21
    /// Inner `VkSurfaceKHR`.
22
    pub handle: vk::SurfaceKHR,
23
24
    /// OS Handle to Window.
25
    pub window: WindowHandle,
26
27
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
28
    khr_surface_ptr: NonNull<khr::Surface>,
29
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for creating this resource.
30
    nat_surface_ptr: NonNull<NativeSurfaceExt>,
31
}

16

}

    /// Collects all the Images associated with this Swapchain.

16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSemaphore.html>

/// A collection of Synchronization Objects used by a `Frame` during Rendering.
125
pub struct Sync {
126
    /// Semaphore to wait until an Image can be Acquired.
127
    pub image: Semaphore,
128
129
    /// Semaphore to signal when Rendering has Finished.
130
    pub render: Semaphore,
131
132
    /// Fence to block CPU access while a Frame is In-Use.
133
    pub frame: Fence,
134
}
135
136

137
138

246

142
246
        let render = Semaphore::new(device);
143
246

145
246
        Self {
146
246
            image,
147
246
            render,
148
246
            frame,
149
246
        }
150
246
    }

/// Wrapper for a `VkImage`.\
126
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkImage.html>
127
pub struct Image {
128
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkMemoryRequirements.html>

    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.

}

impl Image {
162
    /// Creates a new Image.
163
907
    pub fn new(device: &Device, create_info: &vk::ImageCreateInfo) -> Self {
164
907
        let device_ptr = NonNull::from(device);
165
907
166
907
        let w = vk::DeviceSize::try_from(create_info.extent.width).unwrap();
167
907
        let h = vk::DeviceSize::try_from(create_info.extent.height).unwrap();
168
907
        let d = vk::DeviceSize::try_from(create_info.extent.depth).unwrap();
169
907
        let elem_size = size_of::<RGBA>() as vk::DeviceSize;
170
907
        let size = elem_size
171
907
            .checked_mul(w)
172
907
            .unwrap()
173
907
            .checked_mul(h)
174
907
            .unwrap()
175
907
            .checked_mul(d)
176
907
            .unwrap();
177
907
        let offs = 0;
178
907
179
907
        let res = unsafe { device.ash_device().create_image(create_info, None) };
180
907
        let handle = res.unwrap();
181
907
182
907
        let mem_reqs = unsafe { device.ash_device().get_image_memory_requirements(handle) };
183
907
184
907
        Self {
185
907
            mem_reqs,
186
907
            handle,
187
907
            size,
188
907
            offs,
189
907
            device_ptr,
190
907
        }
191
907
    }
<rge::vulkan::shaders::atlas::Image>::new
Line
Count
Source
163
907
    pub fn new(device: &Device, create_info: &vk::ImageCreateInfo) -> Self {
164
907
        let device_ptr = NonNull::from(device);
165
907
166
907
        let w = vk::DeviceSize::try_from(create_info.extent.width).unwrap();
167
907
        let h = vk::DeviceSize::try_from(create_info.extent.height).unwrap();
168
907
        let d = vk::DeviceSize::try_from(create_info.extent.depth).unwrap();
169
907

//! Internal utilities for creating Buffers in Device Memory to be used for Vertex/Index buffers.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// A group of buffers bound to Device Memory.
16
pub struct Buffers {
17
    /// Staging buffer.
18
    pub staging: Buffer,
19
20
    /// Index buffer.
21
    pub index: Buffer,
22
23
    /// Vertex buffer.
24
    pub vertex: Buffer,
25
26
    /// Device memory.
27
    pub memory: DeviceMemory,
28
}
29
30
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
31
32
#[allow(unused)]
33
/// Size of a Kibibyte.
34
const KB: vk::DeviceSize = 0x400;
35
36
#[allow(unused)]
37
/// Size of a Mebibyte.
38
const MB: vk::DeviceSize = 0x400 * 0x400;
39
40
#[allow(unused)]
41
/// Size of a Gibibyte.
42
const GB: vk::DeviceSize = 0x400 * 0x400 * 0x400;
43
44
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
45
46
impl Buffers {
47
    /// Creates the Buffers, allocates Device Memory, and binds the Buffers to the Device Memory.
48
    #[allow(clippy::identity_op)]
49
6
    pub fn new(device: &Device) -> Self {
50
6

6
            device,
52

53

62

/// Wrapper for a `VkBuffer`.\
104
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkBuffer.html>
105
pub struct Buffer {
106
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkMemoryRequirements.html>
107
    pub mem_reqs: vk::MemoryRequirements,
108
109
    /// Inner `VkBuffer`.
110
    pub handle: vk::Buffer,
111
112
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSharingMode.html>
113
    pub sharing_mode: vk::SharingMode,
114
115
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkBufferUsageFlagBits.html>
116
    pub usage: vk::BufferUsageFlags,
117
118
    /// Byte-Size of this Buffer.
119
    pub size: vk::DeviceSize,
120
121
    /// Byte-Offset of this Buffer.
122
    pub offs: vk::DeviceSize,
123
124
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
125
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
126
}
127

6
//! Internal utilities for creating Command Pools to allocate Command Buffers.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// Wrapper for a `VkCommandPool`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkCommandPool.html>
17
pub struct CommandPool {
18
    /// Inner `VkCommandPool`.
19
    pub handle: vk::CommandPool,
20
21
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
22
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
23
}
24
25
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
26
27

41
42
impl CommandPool {
43
    /// Creates a new Command Pool.
44
6
    pub fn new(device: &Device) -> Self {
45
6
        let device_ptr = NonNull::from(device);
46
6
47
6
        let create_info = vk::CommandPoolCreateInfo {
48
6
            flags: vk::CommandPoolCreateFlags::RESET_COMMAND_BUFFER,
49
6
            queue_family_index: device.selection.graphics_idx as u32,
50
6
            ..Default::default()
51
6
        };
52
6
        let res = unsafe { device.ash_device().create_command_pool(&create_info, None) };
53
6
        let handle = res.unwrap();
54
6
55
6
        Self { handle, device_ptr }
56
6
    }
<rge::vulkan::shaders::command_pool::CommandPool>::new

7
8

13

14
15

16

17

19

20
21

23
}

/*
2

5
6
//! Rust-wrappers around GLSL Data Types.
7
//!
8
//! <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)>
9
10
// ================================================================================================================================ //
11
12
#![allow(non_camel_case_types)]
13
#![allow(unused)]
14
15
// ================================================================================================================================ //
16
17
#[allow(unused_imports)]
18
use super::*;
19
20
use core::ops::{Deref, DerefMut};
21
22
pub use core::f32::consts as float_consts;
23
pub use core::f64::consts as double_consts;
24
25
// ================================================================================================================================ //
26
27
/// Internal Trait for associating Rust Types with Vulkan Image Formats.
28
pub(crate) trait VulkanFormat {
29
    /// <https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkFormat.html>
30
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format;
31
}
32
33
// ================================================================================================================================ //
34
35
// Scalars
36
37
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
38
39
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
40
pub type int = i32;
41
42
impl VulkanFormat for int {
43
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R32_SINT;
44
}
45
46
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
47
48
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
49
pub type uint = u32;
50
51
impl VulkanFormat for uint {
52
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R32_UINT;
53
}
54
55
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
56
57
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
58
pub type float = f32;
59
60
impl VulkanFormat for float {
61
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R32_SFLOAT;
62
}
63
64
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
65
66
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
67
pub type double = f64;
68
69
impl VulkanFormat for double {
70
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R64_SFLOAT;
71
}
72
73

// Macros
212
213
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
214
215
/// Creates a `vec2` using 0-2 arguments. Unspecified values default to `0.0`.
216
#[macro_export]
217
macro_rules! vec2 {
218
    () => {
219
        $crate::glsl::vec2(0.0, 0.0)
220
    };
221
    ($x:expr) => {
222
        $crate::glsl::vec2($x, 0.0)
223
    };
224
    ($x:expr, $y:expr) => {
225
        $crate::glsl::vec2($x, $y)
226
    };
227
}
228
229
/// Creates a `vec3` using 0-3 arguments. Unspecified values default to `0.0`.
230
#[macro_export]
231
macro_rules! vec3 {
232
    () => {
233
        $crate::glsl::vec3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
234
    };
235
    ($x:expr) => {
236
        $crate::glsl::vec3($x, 0.0, 0.0)
237
    };
238
    ($x:expr, $y:expr) => {
239
        $crate::glsl::vec3($x, $y, 0.0)
240
    };
241
    ($x:expr, $y:expr, $z:expr) => {
242
        $crate::glsl::vec3($x, $y, $z)
243
    };
244
}
245
246
/// Creates a `vec4` using 0-4 arguments. Unspecified values default to `0.0`.
247
#[macro_export]
248
macro_rules! vec4 {
249
    () => {
250
        $crate::glsl::vec4(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
251
    };
252
    ($x:expr) => {
253
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
254
    };
255
    ($x:expr, $y:expr) => {
256
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, $y, 0.0, 0.0)
257
    };
258
    ($x:expr, $y:expr, $z:expr) => {
259
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, $y, $z, 0.0)
260
    };
261
    ($x:expr, $y:expr, $z:expr, $w:expr) => {
262
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, $y, $z, $w)
263
    };
264
}
265
266
/// Creates a `vec4` using 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 arguments.
267
/// 0 Arguments: Unspecified RGB values default to `0.0`. Alpha value defaults to `0.0`.
268
/// 1 Argument : First Argument is used for all RGB values. Alpha value defaults to `1.0`.
269
/// 2 Arguments: First Argument is used for all RGB values. Second Argument is used for Alpha value.
270
/// 3 Arguments: Specified RGB values are used. Alpha value defaults to `1.0`.
271
/// 4 Arguments: Specified RGB and Alpha values are used.
272
#[macro_export]
273
macro_rules! rgba {
274
    () => {
275
        $crate::glsl::vec4(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
276
    };
277
    ($v:expr) => {
278
        $crate::glsl::vec4($v, $v, $v, 1.0)
279
    };
280
    ($v:expr, $a:expr) => {
281
        $crate::glsl::vec4($v, $v, $v, $a)
282
    };
283
    ($r:expr, $g:expr, $b:expr) => {
284
        $crate::glsl::vec4($r, $g, $b, 1.0)
285
    };
286
    ($r:expr, $g:expr, $b:expr, $a:expr) => {
287
        $crate::glsl::vec4($r, $g, $b, $a)
288
    };
289
}
290
291
// ================================================================================================================================ //

/*
2
 *  Crate: RGE
3
 * Module: Vulkan - Shaders - GLSL Shaders
4
 */
5
6
//! The all-encompassing module where an entire Render Pipeline is created for the RGBA Shaders, from start to finish.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
pub mod rgba;
16
pub mod uv;
17
18
pub use rgba::Shader as ShaderRGBA;
19
pub use rgba::Vertex;
20
21
pub use uv::Shader as ShaderUV;
22
pub use uv::Vertex as VertexUV;
23
24
// ================================================================================================================================ //
25
26
/// A group of related Shader Modules.
27
pub struct Shaders {
28
    /// UV-Shader.
29
    pub uv: ShaderUV,
30
31
    /// RGBA-Shader.
32
    pub rgba: ShaderRGBA,
33
34
    /// Render Pass for all the Graphics Pipelines.
35
    pub render_pass: RenderPass,
36
}
37
38
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
39
40
impl Shaders {
41
    /// Compiles all the Shader Programs.
42
6
    pub fn compile(device: &Device, surface: &Surface, ds_info: &DeviceSurfaceInfo) -> Self {
43
6
        let render_pass = Self::create_render_pass(device, ds_info);
44
6
45
6
        let compiler = shaderc::Compiler::new().unwrap();
46
6
47
6
        let rgba = ShaderRGBA::new(device, surface, ds_info, &render_pass, &compiler);
48
6
        let uv = ShaderUV::new(device, surface, ds_info, &render_pass, &compiler);
49
6
50
6
        Self {
51
6
            uv,
52
6
            rgba,
53
6
            render_pass,
54
6
        }
55
6
    }

57
    /// Creates the Render Pass shared by all Shaders.
58
6
    fn create_render_pass(device: &Device, ds_info: &DeviceSurfaceInfo) -> RenderPass {
59
6
        let surface_format = ds_info.ideal_format();
60
6
61
6
        let attachment_desc = vk::AttachmentDescription {
62
6
            flags: vk::AttachmentDescriptionFlags::empty(),
63
6
            format: surface_format.format,
64
6
            samples: vk::SampleCountFlags::TYPE_1,
65
6
            load_op: vk::AttachmentLoadOp::CLEAR,
66
6
            store_op: vk::AttachmentStoreOp::STORE,
67
6
            stencil_load_op: vk::AttachmentLoadOp::DONT_CARE,
68
6
            stencil_store_op: vk::AttachmentStoreOp::DONT_CARE,
69
6
            initial_layout: vk::ImageLayout::UNDEFINED,
70
6
            final_layout: vk::ImageLayout::PRESENT_SRC_KHR,
71
6
        };
72
6
73
6
        let attachment_ref = vk::AttachmentReference {
74
6
            attachment: 0,
75

pub struct Vertex {
23
    /// Position of the Vertex. Only XY values are used for positioning. Z values represent Depth/Layer [TODO]. W values represent Point-Size.
24
    pub xyzw: VERTEX_XYZW,
25
26
    /// Color of the Vertex.
27
    pub rgba: VERTEX_RGBA,
28
}
29
30
/// Type used by Vertex's XYZW field.
31
#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
32
type VERTEX_XYZW = glsl::vec4;
33
34
/// Type used by Vertex's RGBA field.
35
#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
36
type VERTEX_RGBA = glsl::vec4;
37
38
// ================================================================================================================================ //
39
40
/// All state required for Shader Pipelines.
41
pub struct Shader {
42
    /// Graphics Pipelines for each type of primitive.
43
    pub graphics: GraphicsPipelines,
44
45
    /// Layout of all the Graphics Pipelines.
46
    pub pipeline_layout: PipelineLayout,
47
48
    /// Fragment Shader.
49
    pub fragment: ShaderModule,
50
51
    /// Vertex Shader.
52
    pub vertex: ShaderModule,
53
}
54
55
// ================================================================================================================================ //

57

//! Creates the entire Render Pipeline for the "UV-Shader", from start to finish.

/// A Vertex, used to represent points/colors on various shapes.

22
pub struct Vertex {
23
    /// Position of the Vertex. Only XY values are used for positioning. Z values represent Depth/Layer [TODO]. W values represent Point-Size.
24
    pub xyzw: VERTEX_XYZW,
25
26
    /// Color of the Vertex.
27
    pub rgba: VERTEX_RGBA,
28
29
    /// Texture-coordinates of the Vertex.
30
    pub uv: VERTEX_UV,
31
}
32
33
/// Type used by Vertex's XYZW field.
34
#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
35
type VERTEX_XYZW = glsl::vec4;
36
37
/// Type used by Vertex's RGBA field.
38
#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
39
type VERTEX_RGBA = glsl::vec4;
40
41
/// Type used by Vertex's UV field.
42
#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
43
type VERTEX_UV = glsl::vec2;
44
45
// ================================================================================================================================ //
46
47
/// All state required for Shader Pipelines.
48
pub struct Shader {
49
    /// Graphics Pipelines for each type of primitive.
50
    pub graphics: GraphicsPipelines,
51
52
    /// Layout of all the Graphics Pipelines.
53
    pub pipeline_layout: PipelineLayout,
54
55
    /// Descriptor Sets.
56
    pub descriptor_set: vk::DescriptorSet,
57
58
    /// Pool for allocating Descriptor Sets.
59
    pub descriptor_pool: DescriptorPool,
60
61
    /// Layout of the Descriptor Set.
62
    pub descriptor_layout: DescriptorSetLayout,
63
64
    /// Fragment Shader.
65
    pub fragment: ShaderModule,
66
67
    /// Vertex Shader.
68
    pub vertex: ShaderModule,
69
}
70
71
// ================================================================================================================================ //
72
73
impl Shader {
74
    /// Creates the Pipelines required to run the Shader Programs.

        device: &Device,
77

// ================================================================================================================================ //
C:\Users\luigi\College\Spring 2023\Capstone\EricGrandizio\rge\src\vulkan\shaders\graphics_pipelines.rs
Line
Count
Source
1
/*
2
 *  Crate: RGE
3
 * Module: Vulkan - Shaders - Graphics Pipelines
4
 */
5
6
//! Internal utilities for creating Vulkan Graphics Pipelines.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// Wrapper for `VkPipeline`s used for Graphics operations.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPipeline.html>
17
pub struct GraphicsPipelines {
18
    /// Inner `VkPipeline`s.
19
    pub handles: Vec<vk::Pipeline>,
20
21
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
22
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
23
}
24
25
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
26
27
/// Getter functions for variables behind `Aliased` pointers.
28
#[allow(clippy::missing_docs_in_private_items)]
29
#[allow(unused)]

/// Wrapper for a `VkDeviceMemory`.
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkDeviceMemory.html>
17
pub struct DeviceMemory {
18
    /// Inner `VkDeviceMemory`.
19
    pub handle: vk::DeviceMemory,
20
21
    /// Size of the allocated memory, in bytes.
22
    pub capacity: vk::DeviceSize,
23
24
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
25
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
26
}

/// Device Memory that was mapped to a CPU-visible region.
98
pub struct MappedMemory<'a> {
99
    /// Number of mapped bytes.
100
    size: vk::DeviceSize,
101
102
    /// Pointer to mapped bytes.
103
    buffer: *mut c_void,
104
105
    /// Memory this was mapped from.
106
    memory: &'a DeviceMemory,
107
108
    /// Device that holds the memory.
109
    device: &'a Device,
110
}
111
112

//! Utility for creating `Box`ed values that aren't subject to Undefined-Behavior from Pointer-Aliasing.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //

use core::ops::{Deref, DerefMut};

use core::ptr::NonNull;
12
13

14
15
/// A wrapper for `NonNull` that behaves like `Box` but without the `noalias` constraints.
16
#[repr(transparent)]
17
pub struct Aliased<T>(NonNull<T>);
18
19

/// Converts a Slice of any type to a Slice over its bytes.
15
#[inline]
16
188k
pub const fn bytes_ref<T>(slice: &[T]) -> &[u8] {
17
188k
    let len = core::mem::size_of::<T>() * slice.len();
18
188k
    let data = slice.as_ptr() as *const u8;
19
188k
    unsafe { core::slice::from_raw_parts(data, len) }
20
188k
}

/// Concatenates two arrays.
25
/// # Panics
26
/// Panics if the Output Array's length is not equal to the sum of the Input Arrays' lengths.
27
#[allow(unused)]
28
1
pub fn array_concat<T: Sized + Copy, const A: usize, const B: usize, const C: usize>(
29
1
    a: [T; A],
30
1
    b: [T; B],
31
1
) -> [T; C] {
32
1
    assert_eq!(A + B, C);
33
34
    // The snippet bellow is taken from the Rust Standard Library (`MaybeUninit::uninit_array`).
35
    // It is currently unstable, so it cannot be used directly.
36
37
    // SAFETY: An uninitialized `[MaybeUninit<_>; LEN]` is valid.
38
1
    let mut uninit_c = unsafe { MaybeUninit::<[MaybeUninit<T>; C]>::uninit().assume_init() };
39
1
40
1
    let uninit_a: &[MaybeUninit<T>; A] = unsafe { core::mem::transmute(&a) };
41
1
    let uninit_b: &[MaybeUninit<T>; B] = unsafe { core::mem::transmute(&b) };
42
1
43
1
    uninit_c[0..A].copy_from_slice(uninit_a);
44
1
    uninit_c[A..C].copy_from_slice(uninit_b);
45
1
46
1
    unsafe { core::mem::transmute_copy(&uninit_c) }
47
1
}

/// Intersperses two arrays of equal size.
52
/// # Panics
53
/// Panics if the Output Array's length is not equal to the sum of the Input Arrays' lengths.
54
#[allow(unused)]
55
15.5k
pub fn array_intersperse<T: Sized + Copy, const IN: usize, const OUT: usize>(
56
15.5k
    a: [T; IN],
57
15.5k
    b: [T; IN],
58
15.5k
) -> [T; OUT] {
59
15.5k
    assert_eq!(IN + IN, OUT);
60
61
    // The snippet bellow is taken from the Rust Standard Library (`MaybeUninit::uninit_array`).
62

67
15.5k

68
15.5k

69
70
109k

71
93.5k
        uninit_c[2 * i] = uninit_a[i];
72
93.5k

15.5k

/// Unit-Test to ensure Array-Operations work successfully.
81
1
#[test]
82
1
fn array_ops_test() {
83
1
    {
84
1
        let a = [1, 2, 3, 4];
85
1
        let b = [5, 6, 7, 8];
86
1
        let c: [_; 8] = array_concat(a, b);
87
1
        assert_eq!(c, [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]);
88
    }
89
    {
90
1
        let a = [1, 2, 3, 4];
91
1
        let b = [5, 6, 7, 8];
92
1
        let c: [_; 8] = array_intersperse(a, b);
93
1
        assert_eq!(c, [1, 5, 2, 6, 3, 7, 4, 8]);
94
    }
95
1
}

/// Unit-Test for API Version Strings.
74
1
#[test]
75
1
fn api_version_test() {
76
1
    let variant = 1u32;
77
1
    let major = 2u32;
78
1
    let minor = 3u32;
79
1
    let patch = 4u32;
80
1
81
1
    // From Vulkan Spec: <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_MAKE_API_VERSION.html>
82
1
    let version = (variant << 29) | (major << 22) | (minor << 12) | patch;
83
1
84
1
    let expected = "1.2.3.4";
85
1
    let result = self::api_version(version);
86
1
87
1
    assert_eq!(result, expected)
88
1
}

134
1
        f.write_str(&self.as_str())
135
1
    }
136
}

140
/// Unit-Test for Null-Terminated String functionality.
141
1
#[test]
142
1
fn nt_string_test() {
143
1
    let a = NtString::from_bytes(b"1234\0");
144
1
    let b = NtString::from_chars(&[
145
1
        '1' as c_char,
146
1
        '2' as c_char,
147
1
        '3' as c_char,
148
1
        '4' as c_char,
149
1
        '\0' as c_char,
150
1
    ]);
151
1
    
152
1
    assert_eq!(a, b);
153
1
    assert_eq!(a.cmp(&b), std::cmp::Ordering::Equal);
154
1
    assert_eq!(a.partial_cmp(&b), Some(std::cmp::Ordering::Equal));
155
156
1
    assert_eq!(format!("{a}"), "1234");
157
1
    assert_eq!(format!("{b:?}"), "1234");
158
159
1
    let ptr = a.as_ptr();
160
1
    let c = unsafe { NtString::from_ptr(&ptr) };
161
1
    assert_eq!(c.as_bytes(), c.clone().as_bytes());
162
1
}

 *  Crate: Wyn

//! Synchronous and Asynchronous types for cross-thread task scheduling.
7
//!
8
//! These objects are intended to be created by the `execute` functions in the `event_loop` module.\
9
//! They can then be consumed by users of the library.
10
11
// ================================================================================================================================ //
12
13
#[allow(unused_imports)]
14
use super::*;
15
16
use super::event_loop::EventLoop;
17
18
use core::cell::Cell;
19
use core::task::Poll;
20
use std::sync::{Arc, Condvar, Mutex};
21
use std::time::{Duration, Instant};
22
23
// ================================================================================================================================ //
24
25
/// A callback function to be executed on the Event Thread.
26
pub(crate) type Task = Box<dyn FnOnce() + Send + 'static>;
27
28
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
29
30
/// A polymorphic state that holds either a Synchronous or Asynchonous Future.\
31
/// Each of the Future types contained within have the same API, allowing the same code to handle both cases.
32
pub(crate) enum FutureState<T> {
33
    /// Synchronous Future, used when scheduling tasks from the Event Thread.
34
    Sync(SyncFuture<T>),
35
    /// Asynchronous Future, used when scheduling tasks from a thread that is not the Event Thread.
36
    Async(Arc<AsyncFuture<T>>),
37
}
38
39
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
40
41
/// A container for a return value that will be received potentially sometime in the future.\
42
/// When a `Task` is scheduled by calling `EventLoop::execute` or similar functions, this struct is returned.\
43
/// This will allow users to asynchronously poll or await for the return value of the callback.
44
pub struct ExecFuture<T> {
45
    /// The enum holding the type of Future.
46
    ///
47
    /// A private inner field is used instead of making `ExecFuture` itself the enum
48
    /// in order to hide implementation details from users of the library.
49
    inner: FutureState<T>,
50
}
51
52
impl<T> ExecFuture<T> {
53
    /// Creates a new `ExecFuture` for Synchronous use.
54
30
    pub(crate) fn new_sync(val: Option<T>) -> Self {
55
30
        let fut = SyncFuture::new(val);
56
30
        let inner = FutureState::Sync(fut);
57
30
        Self { inner }
58
30
    }

/// A Future to be used when Tasks are scheduled from the Event Thread,
130
/// and thus needs no extra synchronization primitives to return the data.

/// A Future to be used when Tasks are scheduled from threads other than the Event Thread,
189
/// and thus needs to use synchronization primitives to return the data safely across threads.
190
pub(crate) struct AsyncFuture<T> {
191
    /// The Condition Variable to allow threads to wait and be notified when the data is ready.
192
    cond: Condvar,
193
194
    /// The data to be stored/received, wrapped in a `Mutex` for thread-safe access.
195
    var: Mutex<Option<T>>,
196
}
197
198
impl<T> AsyncFuture<T> {

201

202
4
        let var = Mutex::new(val);
203
4

4

/*/*
2
 *   Crate: Wyn
3
 *  Author: Eric Grandizio <grandizioe@duq.edu>
4
 * License: Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal
5
 */
6
7
//! ***Wyn*** is a cross-platform windowing library targeting Windows/Linux/MacOS, written entirely in Rust.
8
//!
9
//! It wraps the underlying platforms closely, providing a single common API for differing platforms, with minimal overhead.
10
//!
11
//! ### Features
12
//! * Manipulate windows on the desktop.
13
//! * Run native platform event/message loops.
14
//! * Receive user-inputs (such as mouse, keyboard, and controller inputs).
15
//! * Query the state of windows and monitors.
16
17
// ================================================================================================================================ //
18
19
#![warn(rustdoc::missing_crate_level_docs)]
20
#![warn(rustdoc::bare_urls)]
21
#![warn(missing_docs)]
22
#![deny(clippy::missing_docs_in_private_items)]
23
24
// ================================================================================================================================ //
25
26
#[allow(unused_imports)]
27
#[macro_use]
28
extern crate gui_sys as sys;
29
30
#[allow(unused_imports)]
31
use sys::common::utils::*;
32
33
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
34
35
#[allow(unused)]
36
pub(crate) mod common;
37
pub use self::common::*;
38
39
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
40
41
cfg_if! {
42
    if #[cfg(target_os = "windows")]
43
    {
44
        mod win32;
45
        pub use self::win32::*;
46
        pub use self::win32::types;
47
    }
48
    else if #[cfg(target_os = "linux")]
49
    {
50
        mod x11;
51
        pub use self::x11::*;
52
        pub use self::x11::types;
53
    }
54
    else if #[cfg(target_os = "macos")]
55
    {
56
        mod cocoa;
57
        pub use self::cocoa::*;
58
        pub use self::cocoa::types;
59
    }
60
}
61
62
// ================================================================================================================================ //

7

// ================================================================================================================================ //

#[allow(unused_imports)]

use super::*;

/// The `panic` that was caught to cross FFI-boundaries.\
20
/// Lifetime is tied to an `EventLoopGuard` object in the `EventLoop::run` function.\
21
/// ## SAFETY
22
/// Should only ever be accessed by the Event Thread, and only while the EVENTLOOP_MUTEX is acquired by the current thread.
23
static mut PANIC: Option<BoxedPanic> = None;
24
25
/// Flag to indicate a Panic is occuring to other threads.
26
static PANIC_FLAG: AtomicBool = AtomicBool::new(false);
27
28
/// Returns whether or not there was a Panic stored.
29
/// ## SAFETY
30
/// Must be called on the Event Thread.
31
228k
pub(crate) unsafe fn internal_is_panicking() -> bool {
32
228k
    PANIC.is_some()
33
228k
}

228k
}

35
/// Returns whether or not there was a Panic stored.
36
38
pub(crate) fn is_panicking() -> bool {
37
38
    PANIC_FLAG.load(std::sync::atomic::Ordering::Acquire)
38
38
}

Line

38

Unexecuted instantiation: wyn::win32::errors::is_panicking

40
/// Stores a `panic` to carry across FFI-boundaries.\
41
/// If a second `panic` is attempted to be stored while a previous one is stored, the process will abort.
42
/// ## SAFETY
43
/// Should only ever be called by the Event Thread, and only while the Event Thread lock is held by current thread.
44
1
pub(crate) unsafe fn store_panic(err: BoxedPanic) {
45
1
    match &mut PANIC {
46
        // There was not a previous `panic`, so store this one and tell the Event Loop to shut down.
47
        None => {
48
1
            let _ = PANIC.insert(err);
49
1
            PANIC_FLAG.store(true, std::sync::atomic::Ordering::Release);
50
51
1
            if let Some(events) = event_loop::EVENTLOOP {
52
1
                events.request_stop();
53
1
            }
54
        }
55
        // There was already a previous `panic`, so abort the process.
56
0
        Some(_err) => std::process::abort(),
57
    };
58
1
}

Line
Count
Source

/// Resumes a `panic` that was caught earlier, if there is one.

/// Converts integer results from Win32 API functions into Result types, checking whether or not a zero value is truly an error.
72
macro_rules! sys_verify {
73
    ($expr:expr) => {{
74
        #[allow(unused_unsafe)]
75
        let res = unsafe { $expr };
76
77
        if res == 0 {
78
            match crate::errors::WinError::current() {
79
                None => Ok(res),
80
                Some(err) => Err(err),
81
            }
82
        } else {
83
            Ok(res)
84
        }
85
    }};
86
}
87
88
// ================================================================================================================================ //
89
90
/// Win32 Error Code.
91
pub type WinErrorCode = sys::WIN32_ERROR;
92
93
/// Nonzero wrapper for Win32 Error Codes.
94
type NonzeroWinErrorCode = NonZero<WinErrorCode>;
95
96
/// Wrapper type for Win32 Errors.
97
#[repr(transparent)]
98
pub struct WinError(NonzeroWinErrorCode);
99
100
/// A `Result` where the error type is a `WinError`.
101
pub type WinResult<T> = Result<T, WinError>;
102
103
// ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
104
105
impl WinError {
106
    /// Creates a WinError from a WinErrorCode.
107
27.6k
    pub fn new(code: WinErrorCode) -> Option<Self> {
108
27.6k
        NonzeroWinErrorCode::new(code).map(Self)
109
27.6k
    }

21

/// Native handle to a Win32 Error Message.
165
type NativeWinErrorMessage = sys::HLOCAL;
166
167
/// Nonzero handle to a Win32 Error Message.
168
type NonzeroWinErrorMessage = NonZero<NativeWinErrorMessage>;
169
170
/// An Error Message for Win32 Errors.
171
struct WinErrorMessage {
172
    /// Pointer to the message data.
173
    data: NonzeroWinErrorMessage,
174
175
    /// Length of the message data in characters.
176
    len: u32,
177
}
178
179
// ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
180
181
impl WinErrorMessage {
182
    /// Retrieves a new Error Message for the given Error Code.
183
2
    fn new(code: WinErrorCode) -> Self {
184
2
        let mut message_ptr: sys::HLOCAL = 0;
185
2
186
2
        let dwflags = sys::FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM
187
2
            | sys::FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER
188
2
            | sys::FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS;
189
2
190
2
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-formatmessagew#:~:text=If%20neither%20of%20these%20flags%20is%20set%20in%20dwFlags%2C%20then%20lpSource%20is%20ignored>
191
2
        let lpsource = null();
192
2
193
2
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-formatmessagew#:~:text=If%20this%20flag%20is%20specified%2C%20an%20application%20can%20pass%20the%20result%20of%20the%20GetLastError%20function%20to%20retrieve%20the%20message%20text%20for%20a%20system%2Ddefined%20error>
194
2
        let dwmessageid = code;
195
2
196
2
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-formatmessagew#:~:text=If%20you%20pass%20in%20zero%2C%20FormatMessage%20looks%20for%20a%20message%20for%20LANGIDs%20in%20the%20following%20order%3A>
197
2
        let dwlanguageid = 0;
198
2
199
2
        // SAFETY: Because we pass in `FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER`, `lpbuffer` must instead be
200
2
        // an address of a pointer to be overwritten, as opposed to a pointer to a character-buffer.
201
2
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-formatmessagew#:~:text=The%20lpBuffer%20parameter%20is%20a%20pointer%20to%20an%20LPTSTR%3B%20you%20must%20cast%20the%20pointer%20to%20an%20LPTSTR%20(for%20example%2C%20(LPTSTR)%26lpBuffer)>
202
2
        let lpbuffer = unsafe { transmute(addr_of_mut!(message_ptr)) };
203
2
204
2
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-formatmessagew#:~:text=If%20FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER%20is%20set%2C%20this%20parameter%20specifies%20the%20minimum%20number%20of%20TCHARs%20to%20allocate%20for%20an%20output%20buffer>
205
2
        let nsize = 0;
206
2
207
2
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-formatmessagew#:~:text=If%20this%20flag%20is%20set%2C%20the%20Arguments%20parameter%20is%20ignored>
208
2
        let arguments = null();
209
210

/// Data stored within an `EventLoop` object.
22
pub struct EventData {
23
    /// Flag to indicate whether the Event Loop is running or not.
24
    pub(crate) running: AtomicBool,
25
26
    /// Condion Variable for other threads to await Event Loop startup.
27
    pub(crate) condvar: Condvar,
28
29
    /// The native OS Thread-ID for the Event Thread.
30
    pub(crate) thread_id: sys::DWORD,
31
32
    /// Win32 Hook Handle.
33
    #[allow(unused)]
34
    pub(crate) hook: WinHook,
35
36
    /// Win32 Window Class.
37
    #[allow(unused)]
38
    pub(crate) class: WinClass,
39
}
40
41
impl EventData {
42

43
    /// ## SAFETY
44
    /// This function must be called during the construction of an EventLoop, while the Event Thread lock is held.
45
20
    pub unsafe fn new() -> WinResult<Self> {
46
20
        let running = AtomicBool::new(false);
47
20
48
20
        let condvar = Condvar::new();
49
20
50
20
        // SAFETY: This function cannot fail.
51
20
        let thread_id = unsafe { sys::GetCurrentThreadId() };
52
53
20
        let hook = WinHook::new(thread_id)?;
54
55
20

/// The Name of the Win32 Window Class.
82
pub(crate) const WCLASS_NAME: *const u16 = sys::w!("wyn");
83
84
/// Win32 Window Class wrapper.
85
pub(crate) struct WinClass {
86
    /// Handle to the Win32 Module Instance.
87
    pub hinstance: sys::HINSTANCE,
88
89
    /// Atom representing the Window Class.
90
    #[allow(unused)]
91
    pub atom: sys::ATOM,
92
}
93
94
impl WinClass {
95
    /// Registers a new Window Class.
96
20
    pub fn new() -> WinResult<Self> {
97
        // SAFETY: NULL is an acceptable parameter.
98
20
        let res = sys_verify! { sys::GetModuleHandleW(null()) };
99
20
        let hinstance = res?;
100
101
20
        let res = sys_verify! { sys::LoadCursorW(0, sys::IDC_ARROW) };
102
20
        let cursor = res?;
103
104
        // Prepare window class so windows can be created.
105
        // <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-wndclassexw>
106
20
        let class = sys::WNDCLASSEXW {
107
20
            cbSize: size_of::<sys::WNDCLASSEXW>() as u32,
108
20
            cbClsExtra: 0,
109
20
            cbWndExtra: 0,
110
20
            hIcon: 0,
111
20
            hIconSm: 0,
112
20
            hCursor: cursor,
113
20
            hbrBackground: 0,
114
20
            //hbrBackground: (sys::COLOR_WINDOW + 1) as sys::HBRUSH,
115
20
            hInstance: hinstance,
116
20
            lpszMenuName: null(),
117
20
            lpszClassName: sys::w!("wyn"),
118
20
            lpfnWndProc: Some(EventLoop::internal_wndproc),
119
20
            style: sys::CS_HREDRAW | sys::CS_VREDRAW,
120
20
        };
121
122
        // Attempt to register the window class.
123
20
        let res = sys_verify! { sys::RegisterClassExW(addr_of!(class)) };
124
20
        let atom = res?;
125
126
20
        Ok(Self { hinstance, atom })
127
20
    }

impl Drop for WinClass {

    fn drop(&mut self) {

20

        res.expect("Win32 WNDCLASS Un-Registration should not fail.");

    }

//! Functionality for Starting, Stopping, and Interacting with Event Loops.
7
8

// ================================================================================================================================ //
23
24
/// Holds the state/context required to run a native Event/Message Loop.\
25
/// Only one `EventLoop` may exist at any given moment, and it may or may not be running.
26
/// ## Notes
27
/// On some platforms, it is required to run the `EventLoop` on the Main Thread.
28
pub struct EventLoop<'a> {
29
    /// The Event Handler that responds to events.
30
    pub(crate) handler: &'a dyn EventHandler,
31
32
    /// A list of callback functions awaiting to be executed.
33
    pub(crate) tasks: Mutex<Vec<Task>>,
34
35
    /// Platform-specific data necessary to run the Event Loop.
36
    pub(crate) data: EventData,
37
38
    /// Lock that guarantees Exclusive-Access to the Event Thread.
39
    _lock: MutexGuard<'a, ()>,
40
}
41
42
// [These trait implementations are implicit, but noted here for clarity]
43
// impl !Send for EventLoop<'_> {}
44
unsafe impl Sync for EventLoop<'_> {}
45
46
impl<'a> EventLoop<'a> {
47
    /// Constructs a new `EventLoop`, using the provided `EventHandler`.\
48
    /// ## PANICS
49
    /// * Panics if another `EventLoop` object exists and holds the Event Thread lock.
50
    /// * Panics if a previous `EventLoop` panicked while holding the Event Thread lock.
51
23
    pub fn new(handler: &'a dyn EventHandler) -> WinResult<Self> {
52
23
        let _lock = match EVENTLOOP_MUTEX.try_lock() {
53
20
            Ok(lock) => lock,
54
            Err(TryLockError::WouldBlock) => {
55
2
                panic!("Attempted to create multiple Event Loops simultaneously!")
56
            }
57
            Err(TryLockError::Poisoned(_)) => {
58
1
                panic!("Attempted to create a poisoned Event Loop after panic!")
59
            }
60
        };
61
62
20
        let tasks = Mutex::new(Vec::new());
63
64
        // SAFETY; The Event Thread lock is held.
65
20
        let data = unsafe { EventData::new()? };
66
67
20
        Ok(Self {
68
20
            handler,
69

70

// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
77
78
/// Mutex to prevent creating multiple `EventLoop` objects at the same time.
79
static EVENTLOOP_MUTEX: Mutex<()> = Mutex::new(());
80
81
/// Reference to the currently running EventLoop.\
82
/// Lifetime is tied to an `EventLoopGuard` object in the `EventLoop::run` function.\
83
/// ## SAFETY
84
/// Should only ever be accessed by the Event Thread, and only while the EVENTLOOP_MUTEX is acquired by the current thread.\
85
/// Treat as Mutable in `EventLoopGuard` code, and Immutable elsewhere.
86
pub(crate) static mut EVENTLOOP: Option<&'static EventLoop<'static>> = None;
87
88
/// Drop-Guard for an `EventLoop`.\
89
/// Initializes the static `EventLoop` on creation, and Removes it when dropped.
90
struct EventLoopGuard<'a> {
91
    /// The actual `EventLoop` whose reference is temporarily placed at static scope.
92
    #[allow(unused)]
93
    events: &'a EventLoop<'a>,
94
}
95
96
impl<'a> EventLoopGuard<'a> {
97
    /// Constructs a new `EventLoopGuard`.
98
    /// ## PANICS
99
    /// * Panics if the Calling Thread is not the Event Thread.
100
19
    fn new(events: &'a EventLoop<'a>) -> Self {
101
19
        if !events.is_this_thread() {
102
0
            panic!("Attempted to run Event Loop while not on the Event Thread!");
103
19
        }
104
19
105
19
        // `transmute` in order to cast to `'static` lifetime.
106
19
        // SAFETY: This reference is tied to the lifetime of this object, and is removed when this object is dropped.
107
19
        let static_ref = unsafe { transmute(events) };
108
19
109
19
        // SAFETY: We are on the Event Thread and have Exclusive-Access (via the EventLoop's lock).
110
19
        let _ = unsafe { EVENTLOOP.insert(static_ref) };
111
19
112
19
        Self { events }
113
19
    }

242
243
// ================================================================================================================================ //
244
245
/// Functionality relating to executing code on the Event Thread.
246
///
247
/// Sometimes, there are functions will only work if executed on the Main/Event Thread.
248
/// Normally, said thread is under control of the library, and user-code can only execute during `EventHandler` callbacks (which can be limiting).
249
/// These functions provide a way for users to temporarily take control of the Main/Event Thread
250
/// from a separate thread, allowing them to execute any code that must be run on said thread.
251
impl EventLoop<'_> {
252
    /// Executes the provided callback function on the Event Thread, and returns the result.
253
32
    pub fn execute<T, F>(&self, callback: F) -> ExecFuture<T>
254
32
    where
255
32
        T: Send + 'static,
256
32
        F: Send + 'static + FnOnce() -> T,
257
32
    {
258
32
        if self.is_this_thread() {
259
29
            let val = callback();
260
29
            ExecFuture::new_sync(Some(val))
261
        } else {
262
3

    /// Executes the provided callback function on the Event Thread, but discards the result.\
309
    /// Because the return value is discarded, this removes some limitations (such as requiring `T` to be `Send + 'static`).\
310
    /// By not synchronizing the Calling Thread with the Event Thread, a lot of synchronization overhead is removed.\
311

    /// Signals to the Event Thread that there are Tasks that need executed.
329
9.20k
    fn signal_tasks(&self) {
330
9.20k
        let thread_id = self.data.thread_id;
331
332
        // SAFETY: The Win32-Error is checked after the call to this function.
333
9.20k
        let res = sys_verify! { sys::PostThreadMessageW(thread_id, sys::WM_APP, 0, 0) };
334
335
9.20k
        res.expect("EventLoop::Execute Signal-Tasks should not fail.");
336
9.20k
    }

    /// If there are any Tasks waiting to be executed, remove them from the list and call them.
339
9.19k
    fn clear_tasks(&self) {
340
9.19k
        // Must be called from the Event Thread.
341
9.19k
        assert!(self.is_this_thread());
342
343
        // Cannot hold the Tasks-lock while executing a task, otherwise a user-callback might cause a deadlock.
344
        // As such, the lock must be re-acquired/released for each task.
345
18.3k
        let get_task = || {
346
18.3k
            let mut tasks = self.tasks.lock().unwrap();
347
18.3k
            tasks.pop()
348
18.3k
        };
<wyn::win32::event_loop::EventLoop>::clear_tasks::{closure#0}
Line
Count
Source
345
18.3k
        let get_task = || {
346
18.3k
            let mut tasks = self.tasks.lock().unwrap();
347
18.3k
            tasks.pop()
348
18.3k
        };
Unexecuted instantiation: <wyn::win32::event_loop::EventLoop>::clear_tasks::{closure#0}
349
350
        // Remove all tasks from the list.
351
18.3k
        while let Some(task) = get_task() {
352
9.19k
            task();
353
9.19k
        }
354
9.19k
    }

9.19k

344

345
9.19k

360
361
impl EventLoop<'_> {
362
    /// This is the Window Procedure (WNDPROC) for windows of the `"wyn"` window class.

175k

551

552

    /// This is a Windows Hook procedure to catch all messages.
577
    ///
578
    /// Under normal conditions, messages posted to threads (as opposed to windows) may be lost\
579
    /// if there is a window stuck in a modal loop (such as by dragging/resizing).
580
    ///
581
    /// Using this Windows Hook, we can intercept thread messages and respond to them before they are lost.
582
53.3k
    pub(crate) unsafe extern "system" fn internal_hookproc(
583
53.3k
        code: i32,
584
53.3k
        wparam: sys::WPARAM,
585
53.3k
        lparam: sys::LPARAM,
586
53.3k
    ) -> sys::LRESULT {
587
53.3k
        // If no panics have occurred, attempt to dispatch to user-code.
588
53.3k
        if !errors::internal_is_panicking() {
589
53.3k
            let func = move || Self::internal_hookproc_impl(code, wparam, lparam);

53.3k

592
53.3k
                Ok(res) => return res,
593
0

594
            }
595
0
        }
596
        // Otherwise, let the OS handle everything on its own.
597
0

53.3k

/// An XInput Controller.
326
#[repr(transparent)]
327

#[derive(Clone, Copy)]

Unexecuted instantiation: <wyn::win32::inputs::XInputController as core::clone::Clone>::clone
328
pub struct XInputController {
329
    /// Internal XInput State.
330
    state: sys::XINPUT_STATE,
331
}
332
333
/// Maximum number of connected controllers.
334
pub const MAX_CONTROLLERS: usize = sys::XUSER_MAX_COUNT as usize;
335
336
/// A collection of all possible XInput Controllers.
337
pub type XInputControllers = [Option<XInputController>; MAX_CONTROLLERS];
338
339
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
340
341
impl XInputController {
342
    /// Returns an array of all potentially connected controllers.
343
6.91k
    pub fn collect(_events: &EventLoop) -> WinResult<XInputControllers> {
344
6.91k
        let mut controllers: [Option<XInputController>; MAX_CONTROLLERS] = Default::default();
345
346
27.6k
        for (i, controller) in controllers.iter_mut().enumerate() {
347
            // SAFETY: C-structs are safe to zero-initialize.
348
27.6k
            let mut state = unsafe { zeroed() };
349
27.6k
            // SAFETY: The pointer is guaranteed to be valid.
350
27.6k
            let res = unsafe { sys::XInputGetState(i as u32, addr_of_mut!(state)) };
351
27.6k
352
27.6k
            match WinError::new(res) {
353
                None => {
354
                    // No Error, controller data is valid
355
6.90k
                    *controller = Some(XInputController { state })
356
                }
357
20.7k
                Some(err) => {
358
20.7k
                    if err.code() == sys::ERROR_DEVICE_NOT_CONNECTED {
359
20.7k
                        // No Controller
360
20.7k
                        *controller = None;
361
20.7k
                    } else {
362
                        // Error reading data
363
0
                        return Err(err);
364
                    }
365
                }
366
            }
367
        }
368
369
6.91k
        Ok(controllers)
370
6.91k
    }

/// Native OS Representation for Screens.
19
pub type NativeScreen = sys::HMONITOR;
20
21
/// Nonzero wrapper for Native Screens.
22
type NonzeroScreen = NonZero<NativeScreen>;
23
24
/// Wrapper type for Screen Handles.
25

//! Native types for handling Points, Sizes, and Rectangles, and conversions between Wyn and Native types.

impl From<NativeRect> for Rect {
73
26.2k
    fn from(value: NativeRect) -> Self {
74
26.2k
        let x = value.left as _;
75
26.2k
        let y = value.top as _;
76
26.2k
        let w = (value.right - value.left) as _;
77
26.2k
        let h = (value.bottom - value.top) as _;
78
26.2k

/*
2
 *  Crate: Wyn
3
 * Module: Win32 - Window
4
 */
5
6
//! Functionality pertaining to manipulating windows on the desktop.
7
//!
8
//! Once an `EventLoop` has been started, it can be used to open new windows.
9
//! These windows can then be freely manipulated (such as position, size, title, appearance...) by the program.
10
11
// ================================================================================================================================ //
12
13
#[allow(unused_imports)]
14
use super::*;
15
16
use super::errors::*;
17
use super::event_loop::EventLoop;
18
use super::screen::Screen;
19
use super::types::{NativeRect, Rect};
20
21
// ================================================================================================================================ //
22
23
/// Underlying OS Handle to a Window.
24
pub type WindowHandle = sys::HWND;
25
26
/// Nonzero wrapper for Window Handles.
27
type NonZeroWindowHandle = NonZero<sys::HWND>;
28
29
/// Wrapper for Window objects.
30
#[repr(transparent)]
31
pub struct Window(NonZeroWindowHandle);
32
33
// ================================================================================================================================ //
34
35
impl Window {
36
    /// Returns the Native OS Handle to this Window.
37
120k
    pub fn handle(&self) -> WindowHandle {
38
120k
        self.0.get()
39
120k
    }

6.19k

6.19k
271
6.19k

6.19k

    /// Gets the Name of the Window.
281
15.6k
    pub fn name(&self, _events: &EventLoop) -> WinResult<String> {
282
15.6k
        let hwnd = self.handle();
283
284
        // Get the length of the text string, including the null-terminator.
285
        // SAFETY: Returned length is checked by `sys_verify` below.
286
15.6k
        let res = sys_verify! { sys::GetWindowTextLengthW(hwnd) };
287
15.6k
        let nt_len = (res?) + 1;
288
289
        // Allocate and write the contents of the text string.
290
15.6k
        let mut os_buf = vec![0; nt_len as usize];
291
        // SAFETY: The buffer is valid, the `len` includes the null-terminator (as required).
292
15.6k
        let res = sys_verify! { sys::GetWindowTextW(hwnd, os_buf.as_mut_ptr(), nt_len) };
293
15.6k
        let written_len = res?;
294
15.6k
        assert_eq!(nt_len - 1, written_len);
295
296
        // Convert the text string into a `String`.
297
15.6k
        let os_text = OsString::from_wide(&os_buf);
298
15.6k
        let utf8_text = os_text.to_string_lossy();
299
15.6k
        let text = utf8_text.trim_end_matches('\0').to_owned();
300
15.6k
301
15.6k
        Ok(text)
302
15.6k
    }

329
17.5k

330
17.5k
        let mut nt_pt = unsafe { zeroed() };
331
17.5k

332
17.5k
        let res = unsafe { sys::ClientToScreen(self.handle(), addr_of_mut!(nt_pt)) };
333
17.5k

17.5k

340

342
17.5k

17.5k

17.5k

348
17.5k

pub enum WindowStyle {
415
    /// The Window has a Titlebar.
416
    Captioned,
417
    /// The Window has a Thin Frame.
418
    Bordered,
419
    /// The Window has No Frame.
420
    Borderless,
421
}
422
423
/// The Native OS styles for windows.
424
struct NativeStyle {
425
    /// The Regular Window-Style.
426
    ws_style: sys::WINDOW_STYLE,
427
    /// The Extended Window-Style.
428
    ex_style: sys::WINDOW_EX_STYLE,
429
}

443

485
    /// Internal convenience-function to get both Win32 window styles.
486
17.5k
    fn internal_get_style(&self) -> WinResult<NativeStyle> {
487
        // SAFETY: This function's result-code is checked below by `sys_verify`.
488
17.5k
        let ws_res = sys_verify! { sys::GetWindowLongPtrW(self.handle(), sys::GWL_STYLE) };
489
17.5k
        let ws_style = (ws_res?) as sys::WINDOW_STYLE;
490
491
        // SAFETY: This function's result-code is checked below by `sys_verify`.
492
17.5k
        let ex_res = sys_verify! { sys::GetWindowLongPtrW(self.handle(), sys::GWL_EXSTYLE) };
493
17.5k
        let ex_style = (ex_res)? as sys::WINDOW_EX_STYLE;
494
495
17.5k
        let style = NativeStyle { ws_style, ex_style };
496
17.5k
        Ok(style)
497
17.5k
    }
<wyn::win32::window::Window>::internal_get_style
Line
Count
Source
